summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to UBS Bank USA, dated September 25, 2019, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities. The subpoena is part of an official criminal investigation into suspected felonies including sex trafficking and related offenses, and includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed, along with several associated entities.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of a grand jury investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to UBS
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the SDNY issues a grand jury subpoena to UBS Bank USA demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance/Record Production Deadline
events.description: The subpoena commands UBS to appear before the grand jury or produce the requested records to the FBI by this date.

locations: UBS Bank USA, 1000 Harbor Blvd 8th Floor, Weehawken, NJ 07086
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278 (FBI office)
keyFacts: The subpoena is part of a grand jury investigation into suspected violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The subpoena targets financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and the entities Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, and Max Hotel Services Corp.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests that UBS not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The requested records are extremely broad, covering everything from signature cards and wire transfers to online banking IP logs and all correspondence referencing the accounts.
The document confirms an active federal criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell was underway in the Southern District of New York as of September 2019.
